model_usage.flash_description: Thesis extraction, cluster analysis, consistency check
model_usage.pro_description: Quality verification and gap analysis only

thesis.research_question: How can we prevent motor overheating and extend operational time in long-term quadruped robot deployments?
thesis.main_claim: A thermal-aware control framework with real-time estimation and predictive planning significantly reduces motor failures and extends robot endurance
supporting_points: Real-time thermal state estimation using sensor fusion and thermal models
Predictive thermal control with MPC and RL-based planners
Proactive thermal management prevents failures rather than reacting to them
Thermal-aware reward functions improve long-term stability in RL training
Experimental validation shows reduced motor limitations and improved endurance

sample_analyses.description: Background on motor thermal issues and current limitations
sample_analyses.key_insight: Motor thermal degradation is critical for long-term deployment
sample_analyses.thesis_connection: Establishes foundational context for: 'How can we prevent motor overheating and extend operational time in long-term quadruped robot deployments?'

sample_analyses.description: Problem formulation and thermal-aware framework proposal
sample_analyses.key_insight: Proactive thermal-aware control prevents failures before they occur
sample_analyses.thesis_connection: Directly addresses the core thesis: 'A thermal-aware control framework with real-time estimation and predictive planning significantly reduces motor failures and extends robot endurance'

issues_found: Some clusters show moderate thesis alignment

sample_gaps.description: Thermal parameter estimation process needs detailed algorithmic explanation
Missing quantitative comparison with baseline thermal management approaches
